question: In what land was Jeremiah from? (Jeremiah 1:1)
What was Jeremiah's response when Yahweh called him to be a prophet? (Jeremiah 1:6)
choice: He said he was too old
He said he did not know how to speak, for he was a child
He was overjoyed and accepted immediately
He asked to think about it

question: What two actions did Yahweh say he set Jeremiah over? (Jeremiah 1:10)
choice: To uproot and to tear down

question: What did the people of Israel do that was described as forsaking Yahweh? (Jeremiah 2:13)
choice: They stopped going to the temple

question: What did the people say when they turned their backs to Yahweh? (Jeremiah 2:27)
What did Yahweh say about the people's transgression? (Jeremiah 2:29)
choice: They all had transgressed against me
They all had been faithful to me

question: What did Yahweh compare Israel's turning away from him to? (Jeremiah 2:21)
choice: A degenerated branch of a foreign vine

question: What did Yahweh say about Judah's return to him? (Jeremiah 3:10)
choice: It was done with great sorrow

question: What does Yahweh want the people to acknowledge? (Jeremiah 3:13)
What does Yahweh say about the people in regards to his law? (Jeremiah 4:10)
What does Yahweh say he will make his words in Jeremiah's mouth? (Jeremiah 5:14)
What has happened in the land that is described as astonishing and horrible? (Jeremiah 5:30-31)
choice: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests rule by their own authority
The people love to have it so
The prophets do not care about the people

question: What did Yahweh say about the people's sacrifices and offerings? (Jeremiah 6:20)
choice: They were very pleasing to him

question: What does Yahweh accuse the people of trusting in? (Jeremiah 7:8)
What did Yahweh say that the people had made his house? (Jeremiah 7:11)
What will happen to the bones of the kings, priests, and prophets of Judah? (Jeremiah 8:1)
choice: They will be placed in a royal tomb
They will be spread out before the sky
They will be buried deep in the ground
They will be thrown into the sea

question: What was the reason Yahweh said the land was burned up? (Jeremiah 9:13-14)
choice: Because they had walked in his ways
Because they had forsaken his law and walked after the Baals
Because they had obeyed his voice

question: What does Yahweh say not to learn? (Jeremiah 10:2)
What did Yahweh say about the idols? (Jeremiah 10:14-15)
choice: They are a work of delusion
They are a gift from God

question: What did Yahweh call the covenant that the people broke? (Jeremiah 11:10)
What did Yahweh say he would do to the men of Anathoth for seeking Jeremiah's life? (Jeremiah 11:22)
What did Yahweh say he would fill all the inhabitants of the land with? (Jeremiah 13:13-14)
Why did Yahweh say he would cause the people to be tossed back and forth among the kingdoms of the earth? (Jeremiah 15:4)
What is the sin of Judah written with? (Jeremiah 17:1)
choice: A pen of iron and the point of a diamond
A pen of gold and the point of a ruby
A pen of silver and the point of a sapphire
A pen of bronze and the point of an emerald

question: What does Yahweh say about the heart? (Jeremiah 17:9)
choice: It is deceitful above all things

question: What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do at the potter's house? (Jeremiah 18:2-4)
What did Yahweh say would happen to those who devise plans against Jeremiah? (Jeremiah 18:23)
Where did Jeremiah tell the people to go to hear Yahweh's word? (Jeremiah 19:2-3)
What did Yahweh say he would give into the hand of their enemies? (Jeremiah 20:5)
choice: All the riches of the city and its treasures

question: What did Jeremiah say that Yahweh had made his word to him? (Jeremiah 20:8)
What does Yahweh say he will set before the people? (Jeremiah 21:8)
choice: The way of life and the way of death
The way of the righteous and the way of the wicked
The way of the holy and the way of the unholy
The way of the wise and the way of the foolish

question: What did Yahweh say about those who do not execute justice and righteousness? (Jeremiah 22:5)
What will be the burial of Jehoiakim? (Jeremiah 22:19)
choice: He will be buried in the royal tombs
He will be buried with great honor
He will be buried with the burial of a donkey

question: What did Yahweh say he would do to the shepherds who scattered his flock? (Jeremiah 23:1-2)
choice: He would visit on them the evil of their doings

question: What has gone out into all the land from the prophets of Jerusalem? (Jeremiah 23:15)
What did Yahweh say about the prophets who use their own tongues to prophesy? (Jeremiah 23:31)
What does Yahweh say he will send among the people until they are consumed from the land? (Jeremiah 24:10)
How long will the nations serve the king of Babylon? (Jeremiah 25:11)
What does Yahweh say that he will call for on all the inhabitants of the earth? (Jeremiah 25:29)
What did Yahweh tell Jeremiah to do in the court of Yahweh's house? (Jeremiah 26:2)
choice: To speak all the words Yahweh commanded him

question: What did Jeremiah say to the people about serving the king of Babylon? (Jeremiah 27:17)
What did the prophets of old prophesy against many countries and kingdoms? (Jeremiah 28:8)
What did Yahweh say to seek for the city where they were carried away captive? (Jeremiah 29:7)
What did Yahweh say he would do to those who had not gone into captivity? (Jeremiah 29:17)
choice: Send on them the sword, famine, and pestilence

question: What did Yahweh say about writing all the words he had spoken to Jeremiah? (Jeremiah 30:2)
What did Yahweh say he would reverse for his people? (Jeremiah 30:3)
What will be heard in the city when Yahweh restores it? (Jeremiah 33:10-11)
choice: Only sounds of mourning and weeping
Only sounds of war and battle
The voice of joy and gladness, bridegroom and bride
Only sounds of silence and stillness

question: What did the king of Judah make with the people at Jerusalem? (Jeremiah 34:8)
What did Jeremiah say would not lack for Jonadab, the son of Rechab? (Jeremiah 35:19)
choice: A man to stand before Yahweh forever

question: What did Baruch do with the scroll of Yahweh's words? (Jeremiah 36:8)
choice: He read it in Yahweh's house
He gave it to the king

question: What did Yahweh say would happen if Zedekiah would not go out to the king of Babylon's princes? (Jeremiah 38:18)
choice: The city would be given into the hand of the Chaldeans and burned

question: What did Gedaliah tell the people not to be afraid of? (Jeremiah 40:9)
What did Johanan and the captains do when they heard of the evil that Ishmael had done? (Jeremiah 41:12)
choice: They went to the king of Babylon

question: What did Jeremiah tell the people he would do after they asked him to inquire of Yahweh? (Jeremiah 42:4)
choice: He would not pray for them
He would only tell them good news
He would declare whatever Yahweh answered
He would tell them to serve the king of Babylon

question: What did Yahweh say he would do if the people would still live in the land? (Jeremiah 42:10)
What did the proud men accuse Jeremiah of? (Jeremiah 43:2-3)
choice: Speaking falsely and that Baruch turned him against them

question: What did Yahweh say would happen to the cities of Judah and Jerusalem because the people did not stop burning incense to other gods? (Jeremiah 44:6)
choice: They would become wasted and desolate
They would be filled with riches

question: What did the people in Egypt say they would continue to do, despite Jeremiah's warnings? (Jeremiah 44:17)
choice: They would serve the king of Babylon
They would burn incense to the queen of the sky

question: What did Yahweh say he would bring on all flesh? (Jeremiah 45:5)
Where did Jeremiah say that the mighty men of Egypt have stumbled and fallen? (Jeremiah 46:6)
choice: In the north by the river Euphrates

question: What is Moab compared to in the wilderness? (Jeremiah 48:6)
What did Yahweh say would happen to Moab because they trusted in their works and their treasures? (Jeremiah 48:7)
choice: They will become a great nation

question: What does Yahweh say he will send on Moab? (Jeremiah 48:12)
What is the curse for those who do the work of Yahweh negligently and keep back their sword from blood? (Jeremiah 48:10)
What did Yahweh say he would do to the children of Ammon after they were taken captive? (Jeremiah 49:6)
What did Yahweh say would happen to Edom because of their pride? (Jeremiah 49:16)
choice: They would become a great nation

question: What does Yahweh say about Babylon in Jeremiah 50:2?
What did Yahweh say that Babylon has become among the nations? (Jeremiah 50:23)
What did Yahweh say that the nations have done because they have drunk of Babylon's wine? (Jeremiah 51:7)
What does Yahweh say about his purpose against Babylon? (Jeremiah 51:11)
What did Yahweh say he would do to Babylon and Chaldea for what they did in Zion? (Jeremiah 51:24)
choice: He would render to them all their evil

question: What will happen when Yahweh executes judgment on Babylon's engraved images? (Jeremiah 51:47)
choice: Their whole land will be confounded
They will become the greatest nation

question: What did Jeremiah write in a book? (Jeremiah 51:60)
choice: All the evil that should come on Babylon
All the good that should come on Babylon

question: According to Jeremiah 12:1, what does Jeremiah acknowledge about Yahweh, even when contending with Him?
In Jeremiah 12:5, what question is posed about contending with horses, after being wearied by footmen?
choice: How will you do in the pride of the Jordan?

question: According to Jeremiah 14:7, even though their iniquities testify against them, what does Jeremiah ask Yahweh to do?
In Jeremiah 14:17, what does the Lord command Jeremiah's eyes to do, concerning the virgin daughter of His people?
choice: Run down with tears night and day
Be lifted up with hope and joy
Look away in disgust and shame

question: According to Jeremiah 16:10, what will the people ask when they hear of the great evil the Lord pronounces against them?
choice: Why has the Lord forgotten them?
Why has the Lord chosen them for suffering?
What is their iniquity and sin?
What can they do to appease the Lord?

question: In Jeremiah 16:16, who does the Lord say He will send for to 'fish them up' and 'hunt them'?
According to Jeremiah 31:8, from which direction will the Lord gather the people, along with the blind and the lame?
In Jeremiah 31:22, what 'new thing' has Yahweh created in the earth?
choice: A woman will encompass a man
A man will give birth to a child
The earth will be made new

question: According to Jeremiah 32:17, what does Jeremiah acknowledge about the Lord's power in making the heavens and the earth?
choice: That it is unmatched by any other god
That nothing is too hard for Him
That it is a mystery to man
That it is all accomplished through His word

question: According to Jeremiah 32:31, what has the city been to the Lord from the day it was built?
choice: A provocation of His anger and wrath

question: In Jeremiah 37:8, what does the Lord declare will not happen to the Chaldeans in their war against the city?
choice: They will not depart from the city

question: According to Jeremiah 37:17, what does Jeremiah tell King Zedekiah, concerning his fate?
choice: That he will live and reign
That he will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon
That he will be rescued by the Egyptians
That he will find refuge in the temple

question: In Jeremiah 39:16, what does the Lord promise to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian?
choice: That he will rule over the city
That he will not fall by the sword
That he will be freed from all captivity
That he will become a prophet

question: According to Jeremiah 39:18, what does the Lord promise to Ebed-melech for his trust in Him?
choice: That he will have a long life
That his life will be given to him as a prize
That he will be known among the nations

question: According to Jeremiah 47:4, who will the Lord destroy from Tyre and Sidon?
In Jeremiah 47:5, what has come on Gaza, and what is Ashkelon?
According to Jeremiah 52:4, in what year and month did the siege of Jerusalem begin?
choice: The ninth year, in the tenth month
The tenth year, in the ninth month
The ninth year, in the tenth month
The eleventh year, in the fourth month

question: In Jeremiah 52:7, how did the men of war flee the city?
choice: By the way of the king's garden
